body_html:
@ebrevdo can correct / expand as necessary

Thanks @jeanm for filing this issue! I can indeed reproduce the output.

I believe the purpose of TensorArray is to implement dynamic iteration primitives - e.g. scan is implemented using TensorArray:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/ops/functional_ops.py#L506

I'm not sure whether TensorArray is itself meant to be used as you are doing. For the simple example program above, obviously a regular tensor should be sufficient.

Can you expand a bit on what problem you're actually trying to solve? Or were you just playing around with things?

body:
@ebrevdo can correct / expand as necessary

Thanks @jeanm for filing this issue!  I can indeed reproduce the output.

I believe the purpose of `TensorArray` is to implement dynamic iteration primitives - e.g. `scan` is implemented using `TensorArray`:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/ops/functional_ops.py#L506

I'm not sure whether `TensorArray` is itself meant to be used as you are doing.  For the simple example program above, obviously a regular tensor should be sufficient.

Can you expand a bit on what problem you're actually trying to solve?  Or were you just playing around with things?
